page.title: 12FOX HUNTING , HAUGHTON AREA.
page.content: Our area is the territory of the Cheshire Hunt, based at Sandiway. Of the 295 inhabitants of the area, only about 10 regularly ride to hounds, but as many as 100 people, mainly from outside the area, follow by car and on foot and only 2 landowners refuse the hunt access to their property. The hunt is funded by the annual subscriptions of its members - Â£350 for farmers and Â£700 for others. The season lasts from October,when cubbing starts, to February. Regular hunting days are Tuesday and Saturday, with Thursday reserved as a "bye-day". March sees the opening of the season of Point-to-Point races; horses which have been regularly seen out by a hunt official are eligible to compete. The high points of the social calendar are the Hunt Balls for farmers and members in Nantwich Civic Hall in January.
